personAnouncement: I am glad you made it!
smallText: Keep scrolling to find out why you will want to hire me.

sections.title: Overview
sections.text: Back in 2006 I worked as a Microsoft solutions engineer for Maxsoft, which is the leader in the Krasnoyarsk IT market. The company met an order from Telesphere, local television company, ordered to replace their old-fashioned network-drive-styled document sharing with high quality web solution based on the SharePoint Portal Server 2003. Since that time I have developed a multitude of intranet portals for different organizations. Please find this version of my resume. and this version of my CV.

currentJob.label: Current Job
currentJob.text: Currently, I work for Kentor, a leading IT company in Stockholm. My job is a mix of solution design on the SharePoint platform, development and deployment. Not only do I appreciate the technical challenges here, but this company encourages me to develop soft skills and to appreciate the balance between the value that we bring to the company and our cost, which is crucial in today's market.

humanLanguages.label: Spoken Languages
humanLanguages.text: My mother tongue is Russian and I have a good command of English: I recently took the IELTS exam, that placed my usage of the language at C1-C2 from one skill to another.

certification.label: Qualifications
certification.text: I regularly examine myself so apart from SharePoint Solutions Expert I have earned many other qualifications and certifications. Feel free to read about them on Microsoft Certified Professional web site using Transcript ID 693553Â and Accesscode Alexengine.

contentItems.title: Business improvement
contentItems.text: The primary goal of each task I perform is the improvement of your business. After many years in IT I realize perfectly well and always keep in mind that any improvement should bring value to the business and sponsors. Without this in mind even a brilliant effort can end up being ineffective.
contentItems.example: In 2016, while working for the Kentor company I developed a SharePoint Fastrack packaged service to facilitate customer engagement in new Intranet projects.

contentItems.title: Passionate about IT
contentItems.text: Information technology is my obsession, which means I never get tired of doing this. It also means you do not have to motivate me to do a great job since it is my vocation.
contentItems.example: Even when a project manager says 'Ok, let's admit we lost this opportunity', I don't give up and accept the impossibility of the task, because I know that nothing is impossible in IT.

contentItems.title: Long-term vision
contentItems.text: Not only are known problem issues my constant priority, but the many years of experience behind me also allow me to foresee customers' future needs and verify them with stakeholders.
contentItems.example: When developing a request management system for the Bavaria company, I insisted on building a deployment script, which in its turn saved dozens of hours that we would have spent on deploying all the system changes in numerous development and production envionrments.

sections.title: SharePoint Architect
sections.anouncement: Let's make this solution even greater!

keyAssets.label: In the course of my SharePoint journey I've gained architectural skills

contentItems.title: Enterprise demands understanding
contentItems.text: I have been discussing business demands with the top management of different companies and I perfectly understand their interests and the uniqueness of each business. I have also collaborated a lot with IT departments and for these reasons I clearly understand the causes and consequences of their policies and requirements.
contentItems.example: In 2015 Kentor was contracted by a union umbrella organization in Stockholm. Choosing the right type of SSL and SSO signing certificates was a challenging task, but since I had had previous network administration experience, I was able to make the right decision.

contentItems.title: Prototyping
contentItems.text: Making use of a proper prototyping approach for the proof of a concept or for functional prototyping, guarantees the optimal resource consumption, which is essential, especially at the beginning of a project.
contentItems.example: When a customer ordered Kentor to develop a system with complicated screen forms, I quickly developed form prototypes using Infopath in order to identify requirements.

contentItems.title: Negotiating with customers and interpreting their demands
contentItems.text: Often a project budget can be saved just by correctly interpreting customer needs. On numerous occasions I only had to talk to the project sponsor to explain that it was reasonable to postpone building one or another system feature. On other occasions I needed to discuss requirements to realize that some use cases were distorted or misinterpret by sales or project managers.
contentItems.example: Initially a customer requested an employee examination system with a statistics page. When I discussed this demand with the client, it turned out that using Excel reports would be a convenient solution for users, which reduced development efforts by hundreds of hours.

contentItems.title: Evaluating multiple ways of implementing the solution
contentItems.text: Instead of implementing the solution via first completing the implementation approach, I prefer to go the extra mile and consider possible future changes in demand and to consider other implementation options.
contentItems.example: The most popular framework for system elements provisioning in SharePoint is PnP Provisioning Engine. However, I insisted on comparing this tool with Meta2 for one particular solution and it appeared that Meta2 was more convenient for the given task.

contentItems.title: Design patterns applying
contentItems.text: It is no secret that software development is not only a kind of magic, but also a craft with known practices and patterns, which help to achieve better results with less effort.
contentItems.example: Applying these patterns according to formal and assumed requirements made solution design less time consuming in many project.

contentItems.title: Foresee and address future customer demands
contentItems.text: It is crucial for an architect to not constrain the solution by current demands only, but also to keep in mind possible future improvement directions.
contentItems.example: In one project in 2016 for a Stockholm union organization, we needed a search function for content in multiple site collections of a custom document management system. The most obvious decision was to base a filter on the system URL. However, I insisted on filtering based on content types instead. One year later the customer decided to build one more system in the same URL, so the decision regarding content types filtering allowed the use of one URL for multiple systems without any conflicts.

contentItems.title: Complex SharePoint farm topologies design
contentItems.text: Some farms that I've deployed were not trivial and that gave me unique experience in building optimal configurations for specific requirements.
contentItems.example: In 2015 I designed a farm for an umbrella organization and the best solution was to apply multitenancy for isolating search, managed metadata and user profiles.

sections.title: Developer
sections.anouncement: Find out if my competence matches what you need

keyAssets.label: Software development has changed a great deal since I developed my first commercial code. Here are a few examples you might consider relevant to your tasks

contentItems.title: SPFx Delve web part for Kentor packaged Intranet
contentItems.text: I am sure that using cutting edge technology is the best for building long running solutions. This web part was supposed to show relevant documents on the Intranet home page. It was developed as a component of the Kentor package for building Intranet solution for their customers. It was my first experience of developing for SPFx. This particular web part was developed with the use of GQL, ReactJS and SCSS.

contentItems.title: Responsive home page for TeleComputing Intranet Solution
contentItems.text: In 2014 Kentor was a subsidiary of TeleComputing and I developed a packaged Intranet solution so that TeleComputing could deliver it to their customers. My task was to develop a structure, installation package and unique layout that could be used for both desktop and mobile displays.

contentItems.title: Branding for SharePoint solutions
contentItems.text: I am passionate about the look and feel of solutions I deliver. So I put a lot of effort into polishing component's UI and making it stable to minimize the probability of further changes breaking the layout. In order to achieve this I use both CSS and JavaScript for such customizations. I have carried out dozens of branding tasks and I know both the development workflow and SharePoint styles.

contentItems.title: Using built-in SharePoint functionality instead of reinventing the wheel
contentItems.text: Being familiar with SharePoint for already more than ten years I know all its features like the back of my hand. I therefore believe in using high level development: customizing existing SharePoint components and features instead of developing something from scratch. The example shows the usage of the built in SharePoint library metadata navigation, although I had to apply some styling to it.

contentItems.title: Fractal Provisioner: Client Script SharePoint artefacts provisioning
contentItems.text: When SharePoint Online had just started to become fashionable, Kentor needed a provisioning engine for deploying packaged solutions to multiple customers. I developed this framework that allows the user to define the structure for deployment via an XML document.

contentItems.title: Agile development
contentItems.text: I usually work in projects with the adoption of some agile methodology with granting roles and regular standup meetings. Usually I prefer to work with a team because I appreciate deep expertise and specialization. However, I am also used to being responsible for the whole task or project solely.

sections.title: Administrator
sections.anouncement: One more role that often stands apart from development
sections.text: Before coming across SharePoint I have gained an invaluable experience of network administrator. Thorough understanding computer network fundamentals gives me a great advantage when the discussion comes to integrating new solution with existing enterprise application and infrastructure.

keyAssets.label: Here is what distinguishes me in this role:

contentItems.title: Automated deployment
contentItems.text: I believe every configurational change should be automated and scripted as much as possible. I use the DSC framework together with PowerShell scripting. Not only does this save time on applying the same change in multiple environments, such as development, test and production, but it also improves the probability that the change will be documented and it will be possible to find its trace in versioning control systems.

contentItems.title: Configuration management
contentItems.text: This role requires discipline and experience. After spending in total hundreds of hours on fixing mistakes in the deployment procedure, I have learned the value of routines: issuing release notes, updating configuration documentation, logging, roll back planning, etc.

contentItems.title: Capacity planning
contentItems.text: I have troubleshooted performance issues multiple times and I know what the most likely bottlenecks are and how to plan the farm topology preventively.

contentItems.title: Troubleshooting
contentItems.text: Again, since I have significant experience as a network administrator, I perfectly understand the nuances of support and problem solving in a corporate environment. In the course of my life I have developed many useful habits and methods and have also developed a number of tools for effective searching for the intrinsic problem and solution.

sections.title: Contact
sections.anouncement: I look forward to hearing from you
sections.text: Currently I live and work in Saint Petersburg, Russia. However, I'm looking for challenges from all over the world, so feel free to get in touch with me.
